name: Farms
description: Estimated number of farms.

name: Farms
description: Estimated number of farms.

name: All government payments
description: Total government payments include direct payments, countercyclical-type payments, marketing loan benefits, conservation payments, and other payments.

name: Farms
description: Estimated number of farms receiving a fixed direct payment.

name: Farms
description: Estimated number of farms.

name: Farms
description: Estimated number of farms.

name: Farms
description: Estimated number of farms.

name: Farms
description: Estimated number of farms.

name: Farm Households (HH)
description: Estimated number of farm households.

name: Farm Households (HH)
description: Estimated number of farm households.

name: Farm assets
description: Total assets represents the survey respondents' estimated market value on December 31 of all capital assets owned by the farm operation.  For operations where the operator dwelling is considered part of the farm and located on the farm, the value of the dwelling is included.

name: Total value of production
description: Total value of production

name: Number of farms with debt
description: Number of farms that reported notes payable on December 31.

name: Countercyclical-type payments
description: Countercyclical-type payments are made to producers of eligible crops, based on historical production of program crops, but the payment rates depend on market prices.  The countercyclical payment (CCP) program that began with the 2002 Farm Act ended in 2014, as did the countercyclical Average Crop Revenue Election (ACRE) program. Two new countercyclical-type programs have since been established: the Price Loss Coverage (PLC) program and the Agriculture Risk Coverage (ARC) program.

name: Gross cash farm income
description: For farms participating in government programs, gross cash farm income is the total amount of cash received by the farm operation from the sale of agricultural products, services rendered, or government payments received during a given calendar year.

name: Current ratio
description: The current ratio, one measure of liquidity, indicates the extent to which the liquidation of current assets would be sufficient to cover current liabilities.  The value of this ratio will vary throughout the production cycle and by type of business.  Greater liquidity is indicated by higher ratio values.

name: Farms
description: Number of farms receiving a countercyclical-type payment that are a function of commodity prices.

name: Farms
description: Number of farms receiving government payments.

name: Assets: Current
description: Current assets are those assets that will be realized in cash, sold or consumed in the production process within one year.

name: Livestock income
description: The value of all livestock and poultry sold from the farm operation net of any marketing charges.  All sales of livestock through marketing contracts or payments received from prior years' contracts are also included.  For integrated operations, which do not sell the livestock but pass them on to another phase of the operation, an estimate of the value of the livestock moving through the operation is captured as sales.

name: Working capital-to-expense ratio
description: Working capital is calculated by subtracting total current liabilities from total current farm assets. The ratio is calculated as working capital divided by total cash operating expenses.

name: Farms
description: Number of farms not receiving government payments.

name: Total acres operated
description: Total acres operated

name: Gross cash farm income
description: For farms participating in government programs, gross cash farm income is the total amount of cash received by the farm operation from the sale of agricultural products, services rendered, or government payments received during a given calendar year.

name: Direct payments
description: Direct payments are payments made to producers based on eligible historical acreage of program crops and historical yields. Between 1996 and 2001, fixed payments were provided as production flexibility contract (PFC) payments before being redesigned in the 2002 Farm Act as direct payments. These direct payments ended as a result of the Agricultural Act of 2014.

name: Farms
description: Estimated number of farms receiving a marketing loan benefit.

name: Assets: Livestock inventory
description: The market value of livestock and poultry on hand that are owned by the farm operation, excluding animals held for breeding purposes.  Animals that are owned for pleasure are not included.  Livestock or poultry that is owned by the operation, but being raised by another operation under a contract are included.

name: Debt/asset ratio
description: The debt/asset ratio is defined as total liabilities divided by total assets. This ratio indicates the risk associated with the operation's financial structure.

name: Acres operated per farm
description: The number of acres owned by the operation plus the number of acres rented from others minus the number of acres rented to others.

name: Income for debt coverage
description: Calculated as net farm income plus interest on capital debt. Indicates the funds available for debt repayment.

name: Farms
description: Number of farms receiving a conservation program payment.

name: Crop sales
description: The amount received from cash sales and marketing or forward contracts for all crops plus the difference between Commodity Credit Corporation crop placements and redemptions.  Payments received for crops produced in previous years or delivered under prior year's marketing contracts are included.

name: Conservation payments
description: Conservation program payments are payments made to producers that include land-retirement programs where agricultural production cannot occur on land enrolled in the program as well as working-land programs that provide payments for maintaining or adopting resource conservation practices on land in production.

name: Average payments per farm
description: Government payments received across all programs, all farms.

name: Assets: Crop inventory
description: The market value of all crops owned by the operation whether stored on or off the farm. Crops under Commodity Credit Corporation loans are not included; however, crops in storage which have been redeemed from CCC loan are included.

name: Farms
description: Estimated number of farms receiving other types of payments including disaster and emergency payments.

name: Percent of U.S. average household income
description: Farm operator household income as a percentage of the U.S. Census Bureau's measure for all U.S. households (http://www.census.gov/cps/).

name: Government payments
description: Gross value of direct government payments received by farm operations during the calendar year. Programs for which payments are received include: direct payments, counter-cyclical payments, loan deficiency payments (LDPs), marketing loan gains, peanut quota buyout program, milk income loss contract payments, disaster payments, conservation reserve program (CRP), wetlands reserve program (WRP), environmental quality incentive program (EQIP), and all other Federal and State programs.

name: Rate of return on assets
description: Rate of return on assets is defined as net farm income plus interest expenses minus estimated charges for operator labor and management, divided by total assets.  This ratio reveals the returns received by the farm operator for both debt and equity capital invested.

name: Farms by tenure: Full owner
description: The share of farms in the report column that own all of the land operated.

name: Principal/interest payments
description: Reported farm business interest payments and estimated principal payments.

name: Average payments per farm
description: Government payments received across all programs, all program participants.

name: Marketing loan benefits payments
description: Marketing loan benefits, including Loan Deficiency Program payments, Marketing Loan Gains, and Certificate Exchange Gains, are payments made to farmers based on market prices for eligible commodities falling below program target prices. Marketing assistance loan programs are based on current production and tend to provide payments when market prices fall below target levels.

name: Farms by tenure: Part owner
description: The share of farms in the report column that own some of the land operated.

name: Average government payment per participating farm
description: Direct payments received by direct payment program participants.

name: Average payments per farm
description: Government payments received across all programs, all non-participants.

name: Assets: Purchased inputs
description: The value of unused supplies of purchased inputs such as seed, feed, chemicals, fuels, and fertilizers.

name: Other farm-related income
description: Includes income from machine-hire, custom work, livestock grazing, land rental, contract production fees, outdoor recreation, timber sales,  hedging profit or losses, insurance indemnities, cooperative patronage dividends and refunds, leasing of livestock and machinery or equipment, and any other farm-related source.

name: Rate of return on equity
description: Rate of return on equity equals net farm income minus estimated charges for operator labor and management, divided by net worth.  This ratio indicates the relationship between net profits and equity of the farm business.  A negative return on equity is a relative measure of financial stress.  The absolute size of the ratio roughly measures the rate at which a farm business is adding to or consuming from its own capital stock.

name: Debt coverage margin
description: Calculated as income for debt coverage minus the amount of funds necessary for debt payment of current obligations.

name: Other government program payments
description: Other government program payments include payments from disaster relief programs and emergency payments. They tend to be temporary, as-needed Government responses to droughts, floods, and other natural disasters. We include various other programs as well, including the milk income support programs, the tobacco transition program, peanut quota buyouts, and/or all other programs not specified in ARMS questionnaires.

name: Assets: Cash invested in growing crops
description: Represents the amount of sunk costs for cover crops or crops not yet harvested.

name: Total cash expenses
description: Cash expenses represent the total amount of funds paid out by the farm operation during a calendar year.  Expenses paid by landlords or parties for which a contractual agreement existed during the year are excluded from cash expenses reported for farm operations.  Marketing charges such as commissions, storage, inspection, insurance, drying, check-offs, yardage, and auction are excluded from cash expenses.

name: Operating profit margin
description: The operating profit margin is the ratio of operating profit to gross farm income, reflecting total funds available to finance the farm's ongoing operation. The numerator, operating profit, is equal to net farm income (gross farm income minus all cash and noncash expenses minus depreciation) plus any interest expenses paid minus estimated charges for all operator and household unpaid labor and management. The denominator of the measure, gross farm income, includes gross cash farm income, annual inventory change, and any nonmoney income.

name: Maximum loan payment
description: Calculated as income for debt coverage divided by the minimum debt coverage ratio.

name: Average gross cash farm income per farm
description: For farms participating in government programs, gross cash farm income is the total amount of cash received by the farm operation from the sale of agricultural products, services rendered, or government payments received during a given calendar year.

name: Average government payment per participating farm
description: Countercyclical-type payments received by countercyclical-type program participants.

name: PCE price index
description: The Personal Consumption Expenditures price index is maintained by the Bureau of Economic Analysis (BEA) and measures price change from the perspective of consumers.

name: Farms by tenure: Tenant
description: The share of farms in the report column that rent all of the land operated.

name: Assets: Prepaid insurance
description: Outlays for insurance coverage made in the past that are not completely used up.

name: Max feasible debt (7.5%)
description: The maximum amount of debt that can be repaid given current income. Calculated at 7.5 percent interest rate amortized over a hypothetical repayment term of 7 years.

name: Variable expenses
description: Expenses incurred in the production process that vary with the quantity and prices of inputs used.

name: Term debt coverage ratio
description: This ratio is a variant of the term debt and capital lease coverage ratio recommended by the Farm Financial Standards Council. It measures income available for debt coverage relative to required debt service payments. It is defined as net farm income plus depreciation plus interest on term debt divided by annual scheduled principal and interest payments on term debt.

name: Operator occupation: Farming
description: The share of farm operators in the report column that reported farming as their primary occupation

name: Average gross cash farm income per farm
description: For farms participating in government programs, gross cash income is the total amount of cash received by the farm operation from the sale of agricultural products, services rendered, or government payments received during a given calendar year.

name: Average government payment per participating farm
description: Marketing loan benefit payments received by marketing loan program participants.

name: Asset turnover ratio
description: The asset turnover ratio, which is calculated as the farm production value divided by total farm assets, measures the income generated per dollar of assets used in production.

name: Assets: Other
description: The value of all stock in Federal Land Banks, Production Credit Associations, Agricultural Credit Associations, and other farm cooperatives; accounts receivable (including Government payments due); hedging account balances; certificates of deposit; checking and savings balances; and any other financial assets of the farm business.

name: Livestock purchases
description: The total amount paid for livestock and poultry including commission, yardage, insurance and other associated fees. Breeding livestock treated as a depreciable capital is not included.

name: Operator occupation: Something else
description: The share of farm operators in the report column that reported something else (other than farming or retired) as their primary occupation

name: Max feasible debt (10%)
description: The maximum amount of debt that can be repaid given current income. Calculated at 10 percent interest rate amortized over a hypothetical repayment term of 7 years.

name: Average government payment per participating farm
description: Conservation payments received by conservation program participants.

name: Average gross cash farm income per farm
description: For farms not participating in government programs, gross cash farm income is the total amount of cash received by the farm operation from the sale of agricultural products, services rendered, or government payments received during a given calendar year.

name: Assets: Non-current
description: Non-current assets are comprised of working assets that support the production process and farm real estate.

name: Operating expense ratio
description: The operating expense ratio equals cash operating expenses divided by gross cash income of the farm business. This ratio measures the extent to which the cash income generated by the business is absorbed by the annual costs of production. The lower the ratio, the more effective the farm operation is in generating returns.

name: Repayment capacity use (7.5%)
description: The ratio of actual debt to maximum debt repayment capacity measures the extent of use of potential credit repayment ability.  Calculated assuming 7.5 percent interest rate.

name: Average net cash farm income per farm
description: For all farms, net cash farm income less cash expenses.

name: Feed
description: Amount paid by the farm operation for all feed grains, hay, forages, mixed or formula feeds, concentrates, supplements, premixes, salt, minerals, animal byproducts, and all other feed additives and ingredients.

name: Operator occupation: Retired from farming
description: For most years, this is the share of principal farm operators reporting that they are retired from farming. In 1996, 1998-2001, and 2012 it is the share of farm of principal farm operators retired in general, not just from farming.

name: Average government payment per participating farm
description: Other government program payments received by other payment program participants.

name: Assets: Investment in cooperatives
description: Estimated market value of all stock in the Farm Credit System and other farm cooperatives.

name: Other livestock-related
description: Amount paid by the farm operation during the calendar year for livestock leasing; custom feed processing, grinding or mixing of feed; bedding, litter, or straw; pasturing, grazing or custom feeding, veterinarian services or supplies, amount spent for sprays, dips, dusts or any other chemicals, sheep sheering, horse-shoeing, removal of dead animals, branding, artificial insemination and breeding fees, and performance testing.

name: Operator education: Less than high school
description: The share of farm operators in the report column that did not complete high school

name: Repayment capacity use (10%)
description: The ratio of actual debt to maximum debt repayment capacity measures the extent of use of potential credit repayment ability.  Calculated assuming 10 percent interest rate.

name: Economic cost-to-output ratio
description: Economic costs are calculated as total cash costs plus an allowance for depreciation, along with an imputed return to management and to unpaid labor of the operator and family labor.  The ratio is calculated as total economic costs divided by gross farm income.

name: Average gross cash farm income per participating farm
description: Gross cash income for farms participating in direct payment programs. Gross cash income is the total amount of cash received by the farm operations from the sale of agricultural products, services rendered, or government payments received during a given calendar year.

name: Average net cash farm income per farm
description: For all farms participating in any government programs, net cash farm income is gross cash income less cash expenses.

name: Operator education: Completed high school
description: The share of farm operators in the report column that completed high school

name: Average net cash farm income per farm
description: For farms not participating in any government programs, net cash farm income is gross cash income less cash expenses.

name: Assets: Land and buildings
description: Estimated market value of all land and buildings owned by the farm operation.  Any other dwellings, such as those provided to hired labor, are also included if owned by the operation and located on the farm.

name: Seed and plants
description: Expenses for purchases of seeds, plants, and related expenses such as seed cleaning, inoculation, rooting hormones, bagging, germinating, and delinting

name: Farm liabilities
description: Total liabilities are composed of any monetary obligations of the farm operation on December 31. The amount reported includes principal due and any unpaid interest.  Debts for nonfarm purposes, even if farm or ranch assets are used as collateral, are excluded.

name: Average gross cash farm income per participating farm
description: Gross cash income for farms participating in countercyclical-type programs. Gross cash income is the total amount of cash received by the farm operations from the sale of agricultural products, services rendered, or government payments received during a given calendar year.

name: Fertilizer and chemicals
description: Amount the farm operation paid for commercial fertilizers, lime and soil conditioners, pesticides, insecticides, herbicides, fungicides, defoliants, nematicides, fumigants, growth regulators, and rodenticides used on crops, pasture, acreage idled under government programs, seeds, crop storage buildings or seed beds.

name: Operator education: Some college
description: The share of farm operators in the report column that completed some college (less than 4 years).

name: Net farm income
description: Net farm income indicates the profit or loss associated with current production. It represents the return (both monetary and nonmonetary) to farm operators for their labor, management and capital, after all production expenses have been paid (that is, gross farm income minus production expenses). It includes net income from farm production as well as net income attributed to the rental value of farm dwellings, the value of commodities consumed on the farm, depreciation, and inventory changes.

name: Average gross cash farm income per participating farm
description: Gross cash income for farms participating in marketing loan benefit programs. Gross cash income is the total amount of cash received by the farm operations from the sale of agricultural products, services rendered, or government payments received during a given calendar year.

name: Utilities
description: Farm operations' share of expenses for electricity, telephone, and water including charges for irrigation water and electricity.

name: Operator education: Completed 4 years or more of college
description: The share of farm operators in the report column that completed 4 years or more of college.

name: Average gross cash farm income per participating farm
description: Gross cash income for farms participating in conservation programs. Gross cash income is the total amount of cash received by the farm operations from the sale of agricultural products, services rendered, or government payments received during a given calendar year.

name: Assets: Farm equipment
description: Estimated market value of the farm share of trucks, cars, tractors, machinery, tools, equipment and implements owned by the operation.

name: Assets: Breeding animals
description: Estimated market value of all livestock animals held for breeding purposes.

name: Operator hours worked annually on farm: Less than 500
description: The share of farm operators in the report column that worked less than 500 hours on the farm

name: Average gross cash farm income per participating farm
description: Gross cash income for farms participating in other types of programs. Gross cash income is the total amount of cash received by the farm operations from the sale of agricultural products, services rendered, or government payments received during a given calendar year.

name: Labor
description: Expenses for contract and hired labor engaged in "agricultural work" during the calendar year.  Total cash wages include bonuses for all hired workers(including paid family members) and employees' share of social security taxes.  Costs associated with fringe benefits such as insurance, pensions, workers compensation, and unemployment compensation are also included in labor expense.  Wages paid to operators that are not hired managers are excluded.

name: Average net cash farm income per participating farm
description: Net cash farm income for farms participating direct payment programs. Net cash farm income is gross cash farm income less cash expenses.

name: Farm liabilities
description: Total liabilities are composed of any monetary obligations of the farm operation on December 31. The amount reported includes principal due and any unpaid interest.  Debts for nonfarm purposes, even if farm or ranch assets are used as collateral, are excluded.

name: Fuels and oils
description: Farm share of the operations' purchases of diesel, gasoline, liquid petroleum, natural gas, other fuels (kerosene, coal, wood), and motor oils and fluids. Includes fuels used for heating farm buildings and offices, drying or curing crops, and all machinery and equipment (including irrigation pumps).

name: Operator hours worked annually on farm: 500 to 999
description: The share of farm operators in the report column that worked between 500 and 999 hours on the farm

name: Liabilities: Current
description: Current liabilities are the debts a farm business owes which must be paid within one year.

name: Repairs and maintenance
description: Amount paid by the operation for repairs and maintenance of motor vehicles, machinery and equipment, irrigation and frost protection equipment, farm buildings, the operator's dwelling, and any other labor dwellings, fencing, soil conservation structures, drainage structures, and any other farm or ranch structures (corrals, feedlots, feeding floors).

name: Operator hours worked annually on farm: 1,000 to 1,999
description: The share of farm operators in the report column that worked between 1000 and 1,999 hours on the farm

name: Average net cash farm income per participating farm
description: Net cash income for farms participating countercyclical-type programs. Net cash farm income is gross cash farm income less cash expenses.

name: Machine-hire and custom work
description: Amount spent by the operation for custom hauling and other custom work such as land tillage, planting or seeding, harvesting, and soil testing.  Custom work is defined as work preformed by machines and labor hired as a unit.

name: Liabilities: Notes payable within one year
description: The amount of loans outstanding on December 31 that are due for full repayment within one year.

name: Operator hours worked annually on farm: 2,000 or more
description: The share of farm operators in the report column that worked 2,000 hours or more on the farm.

name: Average net cash farm income per participating farm
description: Net cash farm income for farms participating marketing loan benefit programs. Net cash farm income is gross cash farm income less cash expenses.

name: Liabilities: Current portion of term debt
description: The current portion of long-term debt is the amount of principal that will be due within one year of the date of the balance sheet.

name: Other variable expenses
description: Includes supplies, motor vehicle registration fees, transportation and storage, and all other general business expenses (for example, fees paid to accountants or attorneys, registration of purebred animals, travel expenses, postage, and magazine subscriptions).

name: Average net cash farm income per participating farm
description: Net cash income for farms participating conservation programs. Net cash farm income is gross cash farm income less cash expenses.

name: Liabilities: Accrued interest
description: Estimated as the amount of interest that has accumulated since the previous interest payment.

name: Fixed expenses
description: Represents costs incurred by the farm operation during the calendar year, even when there is no production.

name: Average net cash farm income per participating farm
description: Net cash farm income for farms participating conservation programs. Net cash farm income is gross cash farm income less cash expenses.

name: Liabilities: Accounts payable
description: The obligation that the farm business owes to its creditors for buying goods or services.   It is the unpaid invoices, bills, or statements for goods or services rendered by outside contractors, vendors or suppliers.

name: Real estate and property taxes
description: Expenses for taxes on farm land, buildings, capital improvements, machines, livestock, and other property.  Includes all taxes paid during the calendar year even though they may have been levied in another year.

name: Liabilities: Noncurrent
description: Money owed by the farm business for a period one year or more in the future.

name: Interest
description: Amount paid by the farm operation for interest on farm business loans and mortgages, land contracts, and other farm loans secured by real estate, finance charges for operating loans, machinery and equipment loans, or any other interest on non-real estate loans.

name: Insurance premiums
description: Amount spent by the farm operation for Federal Crop Insurance, and the farm share of motor vehicle, liability, and blanket policies which provide more than one year's coverage.

name: Liabilities: Non-real estate
description: The amount of debt owed by the farm business for non-real estate loans.

name: Liabilities: Real estate
description: The amount of debt owed by the farm business for real estate loans.

name: Rent and lease payments
description: Expenses for land rental (including Public Industrial Grazing Association land), all vehicles, tractors, farm machinery, equipment, and structures leased.

name: Net cash farm income
description: This measure indicates the amount of net cash earnings from all business sources that a farm generates during the year.  These funds can be used to repay principal on indebtedness, purchase new machinery or equipment, expand the farm business, or pay for family consumption or other obligations.

name: Farm equity
description: Total farm business assets minus farm business liabilities on December 31.

name: Nonmoney income
description: An estimated value of items produced and consumed on the farm, and the imputed rental value of farm dwellings.

name: Value of inventory change
description: The change in the market value of all crops, livestock, or purchased inputs from January 1 of the calendar to December 31.

name: Depreciation
description: An allocation of the portion of the original cost of a capital asset to each of the estimated years in which the asset will be used.  The type of depreciation reported on the survey typically resembles the figure reported on tax returns.

name: Labor, non-cash benefits
description: Includes an estimate of the value of housing or lodging provided to workers, meals, fuel, vehicles, utilities, or payment in kind. An estimate of the value of products produced and consumed on the farm is provided by the survey respondent. The imputed rental value of farm dwellings is calculated for dwellings located on the farm and is based on rent-to-value ratios for different value ranges of the dwelling.

name: Adjusted breeding livestock income
description: The amount of unrecovered investment in breeding livestock upon sale, reflecting the difference between gross proceeds from the sale and the recognized gain after accounting for investment costs.

name: Net farm income
description: Net farm income indicates the profit or loss associated with current production. It represents the return (both monetary and nonmonetary) to farm operators for their labor, management and capital after all production expenses have been paid (that is, gross farm income minus production expenses). It includes net income from farm production as well as net income attributed to the rental value of farm dwellings, the value of commodities consumed on the farm, depreciation, and inventory changes.
